case.state: Ah! Greetings, ~player~! I am the Dusk Magi, and I am here to enjoy myself this evening.
Our paths cross on this fated evening, ~player~. I am the Dusk Magi, here to bid good evening and ah, enjoy myself.
Hi ~player~. Is this where we’re going to be playing?
~player~? It's been forever! I didn't think our paths would cross here of all places.
Ah, you kinda look like you just woke up, ~name~. Not judging! Just thought I'd bring it up in case you cared.
Oh, hi again Fina! It's a pleasure to play with you again.
Oh, hey Fina! Glad to see you again.
Oh, aren't you the champion in Alola? It's a pleasure to meet you!
Hey, you're that coordinator I've heard about! May, is it? Welcome to the party.
Wait, Misty is here as well!? All the way from Kanto, too!
Cynthia!? The Cynthia!? I didn't think I'd be meeting such a celebrity here!
Hold on, I recognize you! You're that Team Plasma guy!
I'm playing with this creep? I should've known this place was fishy.
Wait, Misty is here as well!? All the way from Kanto, too!
Likewise! It's been ages since we've last talked!
Hold on. That Pokémon just talked! But, that doesn't look like a Pokémon I've seen before.
I’m sure the Professor won’t mind if I play some poker.
Alright, I’m ready to battle- er, play Poker!
My name’s Dawn, and I’m going to discover every Pokémon out in the world!
Just so we're clear, my intentions here are purely social interaction. I read about this place beforehand.
And so it begins! This game of sin shall bring forth our true selves.
~blank~
Let me have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Yeah no, give me ~cards.text~ different ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
I'll take ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ please.
Make that ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, please.
~Cards.text~ more ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer!
Something with a type advantage, if you would please.
I choose ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~!
Switching out ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~!
If this hand were a Pokémon, I bet they would be classified as legendary!
Ooh! These cards sure are shiny!
Hey ~player~, after this, we should have a friendly battle! Just the two of us!
Get ready for a hyper beam worthy hand!
Don’t be intimidated ~player~, it’s all a factor of luck as to what you’ll get.
Well, this Rain Dance just turned into a Sunny Day!
~player~, we should check out the area for any undiscovered Pokémon after this! (That's the best way to ask them out on a date, right?)
If we get a super good hand, can we win back our clothes? Just thinking out loud here.
Another round I get to stay dressed! Partially.
My turn to deal some damage!
I’m still in this battle!
This game is really like having a full team of Clefairy that only knows Metronome.
Uh, ~player~..? Do you like what you see..?
This hand is good enough to leave the others paralyzed!
This hand should at least keep me in the battle.
Oh thank Arceus for this hand.
Phew... I'm on my last legs.
What a clutch attack!
I'm hoping that detective isn't living up to his name...
The nature of these cards aren't really worthy of competitive battling.
I'd say my chances of winning this next hand are the odds of a Pokémon landing a hit while confused.
Okay, let's do this!
Just stay positive! Make the best of this hand!
A Dragon Dance would certainly help these cards. But I think my ATK might be enough anyways.
This hand is somewhere between fantastic and, uh, hopeless...
Just stay focused, Dawn. You can do this!
Alright, this should be enough to recover from.
These cards would really benefit from a stat boosting move.
Well, I'd be lying if I said that this isn't any fun at all. The randomness really throws me for a loop though.
Just need the perfect setup strategy before I can unleash a devastating move.
Okay cards, don't fail me now.
I've still got a fighting chance!
If only I could channel a Focus Energy like a Pokémon could.
(I can hardly stay focused with ~player~ staring at me...)
They say skill always beats luck. This game says otherwise...
Oh please be enough.
My final hand, on low HP.
I hope you aren't enjoying this too much ~player~...
Why couldn't this place have just been another gym?
(Should I pose for ~player~? I noticed them stare at me a few times, but it's been so long...)
These cards stink worse than a Skuntank!
I don't need Foresight to tell me this hand won't be enough.
Oh, I got a--- no wait. That's not it.
I should've paid more attention to to those cards.
(I can't let this bad hand get under my skin! I can't appear weak in front of ~player~.)
I don't suppose giving Pokéyen for a loss is acceptable?
I wouldn't be losing this badly if this was a Pokémon battle.
So how is everyone else fairing? (Certainly better than me.)
I'm just glad the professor isn't here to see this.
Dealer, did Team Galactic put you up to this?
I feel like this is a setup.
Please someone have a worse hand than me...
Years of academy training, wasted!
Nonononono...
A trainer can't run from another trainer when they lock eyes....
No, it can't be...
Definitely shouldn't have given up my socks along with my boots.
~blank~
I'm here for a change of pace, as I can guess you are as well. As fun as battling is, sometimes it's nice to just play a more casual game.
Oh, it's okay, Fina! As someone dedicated to the pursuit of knowledge, this has been very fascinating!

There's the situation regarding Malamar, the evolution of Inkay, only being able to evolve when upside down. It's perfectly reasonable for it to evolve in the wild, but it actually took a long while for trainers and researchers to figure exactly how it evolves.
(Drat, history was never my forte.) Uhh, Joseph Stone?
I bet you're in your element, Misty! All you need now is a Rain Dance to really boost your power!
I bet you're in your element, Misty! All you need now is a Rain Dance to really boost your power!
Uhh... I don't think that's how that works, Wheatley.
...Oookay then. Whatever you say, Wheatley.
Are you sure it's alright if I study Cupil, Fina? I promise I'll make sure he's comfy and try not to take up too much of your time.
Ooh! That would be lovely! I look forward to meeting Cupil.

I'll say I've definitely had days like that. A friend had asked if I wanted to battle and I agreed to it. But I really didn't want to after thinking about it and just hid in Amity Square with my Piplup.
While it can be fun to hang out with friends, I like to recharge my social batteries the following day, so to speak. Especially if we did something big like traveling or battling.
I'll admit that when I'm part of a big group, I tend to shrink to the back and do my own thing. That's why I love Pokémon so much though, they're always there for you.
I can definitely be snarky when I get competitive, but I do my best to not come off as a complete jerk.
Yeah, that tends to happen to me when I'm laying in bed trying to sleep. I do my best not get hung up by it,
Oh no need to apologize! I can see you are trying you're best to make some friends, and I'm here to support you.

Oh absolutely! We go by fire, ice, psychic, dark, fairy, and many more. I could spend this entire game talking about all of the types and their interactions with each other, but I'll end up boring the entire table.

Well, to put it simply; both and so much more. Pokémon and humans depend on each other where I come from. They are vital to agriculture, and are even part of factory work, food service, and police work. At the same time, they are our dearest friends.

Aha well... That's a little difficult to explain. To put it simply: we have classifications for Pokémon called "egg groups". All Pokémon in a specific egg group can produce an egg, though some egg groups are so broad that some illogical pairings are possible. Like a Wailord and a Skitty for example.

Ahh, that's an ancient tale that I am not all too familiar with, unfortunately. I'd have to look back and read it again. There are legends from long ago that humans and Pokémon were one and the same. That even marriage between the two was not uncommon.

That's a tricky question, but imagine a creature that could understand what you are saying and is also a wild animal at the same time. There are very intelligent Pokémon in the world, and they usually fall under the category of Mythical or Legendary, due to how ancient and powerful they are.
H-Huh..!? --Who said that!?
I don't want to pry, but that sort of came up out of nowhere... I won't press on it, but uh, it's probably for the best you don't blurt something like that.

I've heard equally outrageous and whimsical theories. My personal favorite is that the world is actually on the back of a massive Torterra! Obviously there's evidence that goes against it, but I think it's the coolest sounding.
Your Lucario got a letter to join Smash? Sounds vague at best, concerning at worst.
Sorry, but I would never stoop so low as to trick someone out of their money! I would much rather earn it fair and square.
Actually, I've come across quite a few relics while doing field research! Mostly evolution stones, but I've also come across a fossil and ancient tablets!
If he's back from the dead... Hmm. I think your best chance at defeating him might be to counter him with a Ghost or Dark type Pokémon. Might I recommend Spiritomb! It's both Ghost and Dark!
Oh, that sounds lovely! Thank you very much, Fina!
Aha... Well, there was that time I uh, went skinny dipping in Lake Verity. Nobody saw me, thankfully! (I hope...)
Oh wow, I feel as if attending a contest would've been been more important. But uh, you do you I suppose.
A Pokémon that evolves into Macargo... Oh! You mean Slugma?
Really? Huh, that's actually quite the far cry from what I've heard about Team Galactic. I'll give you credit for that one then.
Oh! I'm currently doing an internship to help me become a Pokémon researcher. It's really time consuming, but I've always wanted to be a professor since I was younger.
I uh, don't really drink. But not to be rude, I'll gladly take a lemonade!

...Cognitive deterioration!? Oh my gosh, that's horrible! Chell, you really ought to see a medical professional about that! But uh, I apologize for trying to get too involved in your personal problems. If only Wheatley would not blurt out personal stuff like that.
Oh, I'm a veteran contest participant back in Sinnoh. I retired that little hobby, but if I were to put my heart back into it, I bet I'd be on the global stage!
That's a heck of an ice breaker. Uhh... The most amount of time I've spent naked is probably a little less than an hour. I was feeling, adventurous, and skinny dipped in Lake Verity.
Wait, why a net? Surely you don't mean gloves? Unless of course the cabbages in your village fly.
You- Did you seriously sign up to this place with the name "Daddy"? I am baffled, yet shockingly not all that surprised.
Wow, it's a proper ladies night! Can't really say I've had enough friends to go to a party like this.
Wow uh… Not gonna lie, I'm feeling a little outnumbered here.
Well, let's give it our all, gents.
Wow, the folks at the Inventory must be loaded if they have water front property!
Darn, I should’ve brought my swimsuit.
The water is looking really nice right now. Don't count me out if I suddenly jump in.
Oh! I could've sworn I saw a Mudkip! Wait no, two of them! Aww, they're having a little chat!
The water is looking really nice right now. Don't count me out if I suddenly jump in.
Darn, I should’ve brought my swimsuit.
Wow, the water looks wonderful! I bet there are all sorts of Pokémon nearby!
Is The Inventory supposed to be a competitor for the Game Corner? I don’t see any slot machines or roulette tables.
This place serves drinks, right? I've actually never had alcohol before. I was always a little intimidated by it, since I haven't had anyone to really try it with.
Ooh! I'm totally down to swim in the ocean after this game! Maybe find some Pokémon too.
This place serves drinks, right? I've actually never had alcohol before. I was always a little intimidated by it, since I haven't had anyone to really try it with.
Okay, the folk who run the Inventory definitely are secretly billionaires. I bet this is like a vacation house they're not using right now!
This might be wishful thinking, but wouldn't it be fantastic if we got to spend the night here? Oh that would be so nifty!
A-Are we really playing in someone's b-bedroom?
(The bed looks comfy, but I feel like I'd be walking into a trap to have someone get uncomfortably close.)
Is this the Eterna Forest? The folks at the Inventory sure do have a lot of property to host these games."
Oh I bet I can find a few cute Bunearys here!
Hey ~player~, is it true you discovered Rotom in a forest like this?
This place is nice, but nowhere near as impressive as the Canalave library!
Sooo, does the Inventory own this library, or are they renting it?
Eww, I hate being too warm… Mind if we take this game somewhere cooler?
It's a little too warm for my tastes. Though if the punishment of this game is to strip, having less layers will probably keep me cool.
I prefer the cold really. The entirety of Sinnoh is usually pretty chilly save for the Battle Zone and Sunnyshore City.
Ooh! The cold air here reminds me of Twinleaf and Sandgem town!
I love the fresh air as much as the next trainer, but that's exactly my complaint. Are you sure we're secluded?
I don't know about you ~player~, but I'm eager to go looking for Pokémon after this game!
Shiny hunters are trainers that actively hunt Pokémon in the hopes of finding one that has a rare coat of color. They aren't as bad as Shiny IV Breeders, however.
As good as I am at battling, I think I do better at contests actually. I've won multiple ribbons for my team across Sinnoh.
Has anyone here had poffins before? They're treats that both you and your Pokémon can enjoy! You can't beat home made poffins that were made with love!
This place certainly seems to attract a lot of interesting characters. I'm hoping to learn all I can from each one, if they'll allow me of course.
Does anyone know of any unique creatures that I can study? I'm helping Professor Rowan fill the Pokédex with all sorts of cool Pokémon and make friends with them too!
If I win this, I should make a batch of poffins to celebrate my first victory in poker. You're welcome to join me, ~player~.

I like to think I'd make a great Pokémon Center nurse. Though the Joy Family Foundation has an iron fist on the entire profession. You basically have to be the child of a best friend of a nurse, because training to become one takes years and years.
I've always wanted to encounter a shiny Pokémon, but I wouldn't want to be associated with those ruthless shiny hunters.
Does anyone have experience with studying abroad? I've been considering my options and I want to become a full-time field professor.
With my time in Sinnoh being a worthy learning experience, I think it's time to look elsewhere for knowledge. Any ideas?
If I'm going to become a field professor, I want to study up as much as possible! With that in mind, do any of you have any neat places in mind that I could go and research?

I tried to see about visiting the Galar region to study the Pokémon there, but it's almost impossible to get in unless I have a special visa, and I'm not allowed to bring almost all of my Pokémon. I understand about wanting to prevent invasive species from ruining the ecosystem, but geez!

To be honest, all of the Pokémon from Kanto have been researched so much that I don't really have an interest in going to see Kanto myself. It also doesn't help almost all of the Pokémon from Kanto can be found in every region.
If I had the opportunity, I would actually love to go visit Johto! The region has beautiful landmarks full of rich history. And don't get me started on the Pokémon there!
Hoenn seems like a nice place to go for a summer vacation. The Pokémon native to the region would be a great way to research how some of them adapted to an equal amount of ocean and land mass.

Y'know, I was dismissive of some Pokémon native to Unova that adapted to harsh urban life. But after rethinking my opinion, that just makes them all the more interesting! If the chance comes, I would love to travel to Unova and research all the Pokémon there!

I'll be honest when I say Kalos isn't a region I'd be interested in visiting. Sure, the Pokémon there are worth researching, but I don't see what I could do while I am there besides maybe some shopping. Maybe I'll have a change of heart if I actually end up having to go and do more research on the entire region.
H-hold on, I worded that wrong! I was asking how you all feel about the breeding epidemic IV Breeders cause!
W-Wait! I didn't mean it like that! I-I was trying to get your guy's opinions on the breeding epidemic caused by IV Breeders!
So how do you all feel about selective breeding?

I had the opportunity to keep being a coordinator, but I ultimately decided to pursue a career in Pokémon research. I'm currently working towards my certifications to become a professor. All I'm missing is my last name being a type of tree.

I won't be going on as many adventures as I did when I was Professor Rowan's assistant. But it's certainly something to look forward to when it comes up. Just like the aforementioned evolutions in Kalos regarding specific Pokémon.

Well I couldn't help but be a little envious if I went and saw everyone in pairs. To walk on a beautiful night in the city of love, the moon shining brightly above, with the one that I call my significant other...
When you put it like that... I can imagine people being shocked when we just say we're only friends. I'd be hard pressed to say yes just to make myself seem cooler at parties.
It would be obvious to say the most scenic ones, but what I am interested in is which ones have the best poffins! Assuming they even serve them.
It's okay, Cynthia. I... Am still at a loss for words. I've always sort of looked up to you when I was younger. This is just... So surreal.

Well... I don't think I'm all that busy next week actually. The most noteworthy places off of the top of my head are the three great lakes Acuity, Valor, and Verity. There's also the Eterna Forest, the Floaroma Meadow, Amity Square. Gah, too many to even list!

I actually do have free time next week. Though my question is, what would you be interested in seeing? There's museums, beautiful natural landmarks like lakes and meadows, cool ruins. It's hard to pick and choose on the spot!
Aha... Mari, you're certainly coming on a little strong. I'd be happy to oblige and maybe show you around but, gosh, at least take me on a date first. Hehe...

Aha, thanks, Mari! Most of the stuff I wear is just typical fashion over in Sinnoh. Nothing too special! But if you're that interested, I'd be glad to take you to the department store in Veilstone City.
You're too kind, Mari. My attire is considered rather humble during the warmer seasons in Sinnoh. If you're interested, I can see about taking you to the department store in Veilstone City!

The more you two talk about this Parfet person, the more I'd like to meet them just to hear their voice. The prospect of meeting someone from somewhere so far away with the voice as me is very interesting.

Aha, well... We were good friends, but ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ and I never really got any further than that. And we had just met again through this game, after all.
(I do sometimes wonder what it would be like if ~player~ and I were more than friends...)

Well, I've had my eye on the Inventory and noticed so many unique individuals frequent it. People from different places in the world, even space shockingly. Who wouldn't want to see what this place was about?
Really? Wow, that's uh... Interesting. I shouldn't be judging your culture so insensitively, but that almost makes me think if I would still be doing research if I was born on your home world.
Wow! Even across the stars, the world truly is a small one! I mean, it's just pure coincidence that she has a similar voice to mine, but still.
Well, there are some Pokémon that are surprisingly mechanical in nature. If given the opportunity, I'd be happy to show her a Magnemite or Voltorb!

Actually, there are a very large variety of Pokémon that can survive in many habitats. While the ones I am accustomed to the most are from a colder climate, many can survive in deserts, jungles, oceans, and even space itself!
Oh, does Roanapur have its own Pokémon League? I don't do much competing nowadays, but if I had to name my strongest... it would have to be my Torterra. Its Frenzy Plant is its most dangerous move!
I'll go ahead and take that as a compliment. Thank you, Revy. I hope you are able to keep your voice for much longer.
Uh, no actually. My mom taught me how to do my hair. I mean, it's a possibility she got it from a similar source.
Why thank you, Sucrose. I think your outfit looks lovely. Though, you're an alchemist, correct? It doesn't quite look very uh, lab safe.
Ah, thank you again, Sucrose. I just make sure to shampoo and use conditioner. I'd be happy to share some tips with you.
Not only collect and battle, but I do an extensive amount of research on said creatures. We call them Pokémon where I come from.
Nope! Pokémon are actually quite gentle creatures, no matter how large and intimidating some can be. Sadly, some people take advantage of their gentle natures and use them for nefarious purposes.

Oh, a large variety of things can trigger a Pokémon to evolve! Evolution stones, trading them while they hold certain items, the strength of the Pokémon itself and the bond it holds with it's trainer...
Oh yes, definitely. It's taken me quite a bit to earn my credentials and my reference from Professor Rowan.

Well, it all started a long time ago when we were a lot younger. Professor Rowan and I had left our basket that had some Pokémon in it, and when we came back to retrieve it, ~player~ and their friend were using those Pokémon to defend themselves from wild Pokémon!

Ah, right, should probably explain that bit. ~player.ifMale(Him|Her)~ and I were friends when we were younger. I was there when they got their first Pokémon, and I even taught them how catch Pokémon too!
Huh? Hold on! When I say battling, I mean Pokémon battling! It's when two Pokémon trainers have a friendly bout between their Pokémon!
Wa--- Hold on a minute! I don't do the battling myself if that's what you're implying, Petra! I'm talking about Pokémon battling, when two trainers compete in a friendly spar between their Pokémon.

I study Pokémon, Pokémon evolution to be exact. To put it simply:
Imagine how you looked when you were much younger, and over your life, you've experienced it all and became who you are now. Well, Pokémon evolution is a bit more extreme.

Absolutely! I was always outside when I was younger, going on adventures to fill in the Pokédex for Professor Rowan. Nowadays, I'm not outside as much too often, but I'll be doing field research more often again once I become a full fledged professor myself.
Oh of course. I still go visit as often as I can. Sandgem is a beautiful little town on the coast, and just a short walk away from Lake Verity too!
See, a lot of the studying I do is through various academies in Sinnoh. It's a very taxing degree to chase, thus why I'm here.

Well, I'll save ~player~ some face with this one. One time, I dropped my Pokédex in Veilstone city and some Team Galactic jerks stole it. ~Player~ and I teamed up and beat them in a Pokémon battle to win it back! Well, it was more like ~player~ carried the battle, ~player.ifMale(he|she)~ was always so good at battling.
Well, Fina, I aid Professor Rowan in researching Pokémon evolution. Approximately 90% of all known Pokémon are connected in some way to others through evolution.
Aha... I would just be worried about your reputation. Mine would be fine, better off if anything! But you you know how rumors spread.
Ah well, tis all fair in the game of chance. I shouldn't tempt fate by attempting to cheat.
Another loss? Understandable, though do not expect much from me. In fact, prepare for no more losses from me!
I have already sacrificed my lovely hat for you lot! I suppose your thirst is insatiable.
Ahh, there is no hiding any longer. My incantations are working, aren't they? Marvelous! Allow me if you will, to up the effect...
Aha... Perhaps my incantations are working too well. I can't exactly go back on them either, not without ahem... a release.
So then, my incantations are stronger than I previosuly thought. Perhaps there is a workaround to dampen the effects...
Now, I did say I desired to "cut loose", but... Forgive my hesitation, I am only a little nervous.
I was enjoying being clothed. But, trainers must abide by the rules.
Oh, I s-supose it's my turn.
I guess it is a little unfair for me to still be fully dressed...
There goes my winning streak. The cruel uphill battle that is luck wages on.
Um, would it be too much to ask if taking away each of my pokéballs counts as accessories?
I mean, I was sitting comfortable with my still fairly clothed self, but if you insist.
Was hoping I would get farther without losing much more.
Shoot, thought I had it that time!
I was pretty proud of that winning streak. Like I was blowing away judges at a contest!
W-well, I suppose it was rather unfair of me to still have my ~clothing~ on when everyone else is missing their uh, equivalents.
So uh, I may have come without a bra... Call it hubris on my part.
Hold on... I uhh... Crud. Maybe assuming I wouldn't get this far was entirely my fault.
B-But, this is my last line of defense!
Hold on, I have a pair! I--- Ah, I do have the weakest hand. Crud.
Wait, I lost with a pair? I mean, it isn't the strongest hand I admit, but... Oh alright.
H-how!? I have three of a kind and I still lose!?
I lost? With two pairs? Of all the... fine, guess I do have the weakest hand.
Uhh, fold! ...What do you mean I can't fold?
Ah wait, what about--- No wait, that is a losing hand. Darn.
Crud, and I thought this hand would have been just enough.
There goes more of my clothes...
Is it too late to actually start battling? I'd be doing better if we were battling!
Y'know, this would be more fun if I wasn't losing a bunch.
If we were relaxing over by Lake Verity, I wouldn't be so shy.
Ah yeah, I know. I was confident in my skill that I wouldn't get this far.
Crud.
I... *ahem*
Y'see, I read the rules before entering. But, I just wasn't expecting to go first...
Crud, really? I'm first?
Well, that certainly wasn't a good first battle.
My DEF was lacking already...
Oh um, my turn again? That's nifty...
Y'know, we can just start battling and... Yeah I know, gotta follow through.
I feel like I keep getting targeted by OHKO attacks and they all keep connecting!
Why don't we all just take the time to appreciate my ~clothing~, and how great it looks still on me.
Uhh, actually! It's opposite day! So with those rules in mind, it's all of your guy's turn to strip!
Oh... I might be uh, a little "under dressed" for this game. I was confident that I was gonna win. Quite the opposite of what's happening...
I uh, might've believed in myself too much... I'm a little "unprepared".
Waitwait, can I possibly give the dealer some of my Pokéyen instead of my... Necessities?

I have indeed. My first impressions are that there is some strange connection between certain Pokémon, and these "evolution-ite" stones. I would have to go over and investigate it myself, considering Sinnoh doesn't have anything regarding mega evolution.
Ah... Do the battles there get as, heated, as I imagine they do? Aha. It would actually be a great way to collect research though.
Oh well how about this? If you plan on going any time soon, I'd be happy to accompany you! Ah, that was a tad bold of me. I meant it in good faith.

Haha, yeah... (Hang on a minute, why am I so flustered all of second? The thought of being in a relationship with Cynthia is... But she's so cool and respected by everyone! I'm just a normal person compared to her. Oh Arceus, I hope I didn't come off as rude just then!)
... Cynthia, you're still talking about "pretending" to be in a relationship, right?

This is an incredibly awkward time to be admitting feelings... But, I will admit I've uh... I've had "fantasies" here and there. So, I will say that I am rather open to the idea of an actual relationship.

First that comes to mind is the Clefairy evolution line. There's no direct evidence, buuutt there happens to be a bunch more of them whenever there's a meteor shower or one lands on the planet. Then there's also the fact that some Pokémon are more machine than well, anything else.
My socks? Oh, just cotton and elastic. They aren't super special, but they help with keeping foliage out of my boots when I'm doing field research!
Oh it's alright, Sucrose. I agree that it really completes my look, but the objective of the game is to lose our look, so to speak.

Actually, it's more so studying the Pokémon that do evolve versus the ones who don't. Some evolve once or up to two times, some don't evolve at all! Then there's the legendary Pokémon that have been said to exist for ages now, and how they've never evolved either.
Oh yeah, it'd be way too warm to wear a hat like this in Hoenn. But I'd totally wear a cute sun hat to replace my usual.
...Aah but, that'd be silly! The Sinnoh champion and an up and coming professor, as a couple? Pssh! Is it getting warmer, or is it just me?
I have been researching a variety of incantations as of late that have many applications. Making people sad, happy, putting them into a trance, and even some "bedroom applications"...
Now when I said I won't cheat, I wasn't exactly lying. But ah, hmm... I shan't say more, lovelies. Let this be a prelude to our night together.
Allow me to tease you a little. These glasses are not rose tinted, but I can assure you that even without them, the world is better with you in it, my lovelies.
There is no need for you to spare me formalities. We are gathered here for the same reason, one way or another. Gaze upon me, my dears. Let my incantations take hold.
(I must be careful with my words from here on, it appears I may have laid it on a little thick.) Umm... Here I go!
Bah! Who am I kidding anymore? The writing is on the wall. Our gathering is for one purpose, and I intend to "cut loose" as it were.
And so my last incantation comes into play. I know hardly any of you will be able resist it.
Well, it is a little warm. I guess I can take off both my boots and socks. Not like I'm going to be doing any field research today.
I can afford to lose my boots and socks. Heck, I should've left my shoes at the door! Lemme just get them off too.
No, not my hat! It's the latest in outdoor fashion, and it completes my look.
My hat? Say it ain't so! The hat that completes my look and keeps me warm during the chilly Sinnoh afternoons and nights!
My scarf could've gone first and I would've been fine. But now I'm starting to regret taking off my socks alongside my boots.
Okay, it's just my shirt... No big deal. You're still in this battle.
